articles.title: A Malibu Barbie Café pop-up is coming to Boston
articles.description:
The interactive Barbie-themed dining experience is scheduled to open April 17 near Faneuil Hall.

The post A Malibu Barbie Café pop-up is coming to Boston appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Malibu Barbie Café pop-up opens April 17 near Faneuil Hall.
The interactive dining experience aims to attract local families and Barbie fans.
Boston residents can enjoy themed food and activities for a limited time.

articles.title: Moderna says the FDA will consider its new flu shot after resolving a public dispute
articles.description:
Moderna announced the change Wednesday, about a week after revealing that the FDA’s vaccine chief was refusing to review the new vaccine, made with Nobel Prize-winning mRNA technology.

The post Moderna says the FDA will consider its new flu shot after resolving a public dispute appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Moderna's new flu shot will be reviewed by the FDA after a public dispute.
The vaccine utilizes Nobel Prize-winning mRNA technology for enhanced effectiveness.
Boston residents may soon have access to an innovative flu vaccine option.

articles.title: Baystate Health will no longer prescribe hormones to trans youth
articles.description:
Threats to federal funding for Medicaid and Medicare prompted the decision.

The post Baystate Health will no longer prescribe hormones to trans youth appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Baystate Health ceases hormone prescriptions for trans youth due to funding threats.
Decision affects local trans youth healthcare access in Massachusetts.
Potential loss of federal Medicaid and Medicare funding influences healthcare policies.

articles.title: Gloucester struggles for answers as search for sunken fishing boat continues
articles.description:
The investigation into the Lily Jean’s sinking has entered its “next phase” as authorities work to provide families closure, officials said.

The post Gloucester struggles for answers as search for sunken fishing boat continues appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Authorities continue search for the sunken fishing boat Lily Jean off Gloucester.
Investigation has entered a new phase to provide closure for families affected.
Local fishing community remains anxious as search efforts persist for answers.

articles.title: A new hotel has been approved in Boston’s Seaport
articles.description:
It's across from the Thomas M. Menino Convention and Exhibition Center.

The post A new hotel has been approved in Boston’s Seaport appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston's Seaport will welcome a new hotel approved near the convention center.
The hotel is located directly across from the Thomas M. Menino Convention and Exhibition Center.
This development aims to boost local tourism and create job opportunities for residents.

articles.title: $22m Beacon Hill townhome sale sets Boston’s single-family home sale record
articles.description:
Crest City Capital announced the sale on Tuesday after transforming the four-story residence.

The post $22m Beacon Hill townhome sale sets Boston’s single-family home sale record appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Crest City Capital sold a Beacon Hill townhome for $22 million, setting a new record.
The four-story residence was transformed before the sale, enhancing its market value.
This record sale reflects rising luxury home prices in Boston, impacting local real estate trends.
